section.title: workflow step, creating new Workflow Step
section.para:
To create a new workflow item, select the NEW button. The following screen will appear:
Workflow Step
You can use workflow to build up complex process flows.

listitem.para: Identify the module for the workflow.
Type is for each module. The type changes to reflect the module. For example, the Sales will impact the Sales Type. For Quality module, you use the Quality Type.
Standard actions are used to drive the activity list and open up screens automatically. The different modules will show different options in the dropdown.
A brief statement summarizing the purpose of the workflow.
The system will send notifications to these people.
The system will send notifications to these people.
This is the profile that is attached to the workflow step.
Identifies the current state of the workflow.
Dates are used to define when a subsequent step must begin.
Dates are used to define when a subsequent step must be completed.
An open text field for additional notes relating to the workflow

section.para: You are able to define next steps for when a workflow is complete and has passed or finished any requirements.

listitem.para: All the possible steps for once the workflow is completed.
The next steps once the workflow is completed.

section.para: You are able to define next steps for when a workflow has not been successfully completed or has failed. If it fails, there may be a next step. Multiple steps can be chained together. The options are dependent only on your business process.

listitem.para: All the possible steps for once the workflow is deferred.
The next steps once the workflow is deferred.
